content: Investments Asked by AnonymousAsked on 20 Sep 2019Any recommendation as to investing in which type of REITS if I'm willing to invest somewhere between $5-$10k?This is my first time buying REITs.2 answersAnswerBump0
Answers (2)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Eric Ong CfaLevel 5. GeniusAnswered on 21 Sep 2019Long Short, invest in REITs that you have more knowledge on. Best is you are one of the beneficial/clients/indirect users of the REITs itself.So you would have the best knowledge of the REITs moving forward.
However, I would strongly recommend to pick up this book before investing.https://www.goodreads.com/en/book/show/17883242-value-investing-in-reitsCan find this book in the National library too.http://catalogue.nlb.gov.sg/cgi-bin/spydus.exe/FULL/WPAC/BIBENQ/3726793/3137180,10 comments6

Ang Yee Gary, Medicine at National University Of SingaporeLevel 4. ProdigyAnswered on 21 Sep 2019What is your required rate returnIn general, single country REIT is higher risk than multi-country REIT. 
However, there is currency risk if u buy multi-country REITSimilarly
Specialised REITs are harder to find new tenants than general REITs so that affects Yr choiceIndustrial >hotel> shopping mall0 comments2
